page.title: 01MOBBERLEY
page.content: {MOBBERLEY Mobberley is one of the largest parishes in England, covering twelve and a half square miles. It encompasses many widely dispersed hamlets which are set in gently undulating countryside and it remains mainly unaffected by the urban and industrial developements of nearby Manchester. The block which is covered by this investigation is to the north of Mobberley Village and therefore covers some of the hamlets and not Mobberley itself. On the next few pages the following issues will be reviewed: {Local {History, Ecology, Customs, Farming, {Transport, Supernatural, Clubs and {Arts and Crafts, Landscape & {Buildings. }
